snippet: Mr. Obama traveled to suburban Pittsburgh to announce nearly $600 million in job training grants and separately issued a statement attacking House Republicans for blocking an overhaul of immigration law.
abstract: President Obama, in suburban Pittsburgh, announces nearly $600 million in job training grants and separately issues statement attacking House Republicans for blocking an overhaul of immigration law; he is seeking to shore up support for midterm elections that threaten to cost his party control of Senate.

byline.original: By EMMARIE HUETTEMAN and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: Emmarie Huetteman reported from Oakdale, Pa., and Peter Baker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Obama traveled to suburban Pittsburgh to announce nearly $600 million in job training grants and separately issued a statement attacking House Republicans for blocking an overhaul of immigration law.

headline.main: Obama Looks for Midterm Advantage on Job Training and Immigration
headline.print_headline: Obama Looks for Midterm Advantage on Job Training and Immigration
